qas.question: When did Armenia's church become independent?
What type of Catholicism is Armenia's church part of?
Where was the Armenian Catholicosate located at first?
Where did the Armenian Catholicosate move to?
When did the Echmiadzin church gain independence?

plausible_answers.text: as a result of its stance regarding the Council of Chalcedon

qas.question: Why did the Echmiadzin church become independent?
What church is part of the Eastern Orthodox communion?

plausible_answers.text: preserve and protect its unique identity

qas.question: What did the Council of Chalcedon depend on the church to do?
Where did Echmiadzin move to because it was safer?

context: Armenia established a Church that still exists independently of both the Catholic and the Eastern Orthodox churches, having become so in <a0_0><b5_0>451 AD<b5_0/><a0_0/> <b6_0>as a result of its stance regarding the Council of Chalcedon<b6_0/>. Today this church is known as <b7_0>the <a1_0>Armenian Apostolic Church<b7_0/><a1_0/>, which is a part of the <a2_0>Oriental Orthodox<a2_0/> communion, not to be confused with the Eastern Orthodox communion. During its later political eclipses, Armenia depended on the church to <b8_0>preserve and protect its unique identity<b8_0/>. The original location of the Armenian Catholicosate is <a3_0>Echmiadzin<a3_0/>. However, the continuous upheavals, which characterized the political scenes of Armenia, made the political power move to safer places. The Church center moved as well to different locations together with the political authority. Therefore, it eventually moved to <a4_0><b9_0>Cilicia<b9_0/><a4_0/> as the Holy See of Cilicia.
